issue.title: Editing nuances as of v0.10.0
issue.body: I was thinking of adding more to the existing issue about the list of improvements, but these are more focused on the existing state of editing. Only the first bullet point is limited to Linux from my observation: * `Ctrl + Y` isn't supported, though the equivalent `Ctrl + Shift + Z` is. The Xfce DE might be relevant here. * When alt-tabbing, the focus on the editor is often lost. I would expect it to automatically focus the cursor back to the position where it last was before the alt-tabbing. But it's quite uncommon so I haven't noticed a pattern. * Pressing `)` before an existing one only jumps forward, so I need to press `)` twice to have it typed out. This is despite me having turned off the `()` autocompletion. I would have expected this to be affected by the same option. The same goes for `[]` etc. * There's a tiny `>` at the top of the cursor sometimes (see image). * Sometimes, the starting indentation is unbreakable (can't be deleted with backspace), e.g. the start of a list. I assume it's still the case in the newest version v0.10.0 even though I couldn't make it happen. * When a line wraps multiple rows, pressing `End` moves the cursor to the end of the current **row**, not the entire **line**. But when pressing `Home`, it always takes you to the very beginning of the line (or up to where it's indented). So to reach the end/start of a wrapped line: * By pressing `End` ... it's not possible, because it only takes you to the end of the current row, and stays there no matter how many times you press it. * By pressing `Home` ... up to two presses if the line has any indentation. Starting indentation also appears to cause the `Home` to just toggle back and forth in place. Meaning you stay on the current line when pressing it. Implementation in different programs: * Windows Notepad: * Pressing `End` ... takes you to the end of the current **row**. Multiple presses move you up multiple rows. * Pressing `Home` ... takes you to tne start of the current **row**. Multiple presses move you up multiple rows. * Sublime: * Pressing `End` ... requires up to two presses (if line has more than a row) to get to the end of the line. It stays there if you continue on pressing it. * Pressing `Home` ... requires up to two presses (in case there's starting indentation) to get to the very start of the line. Starting indentation also appears to cause the `Home` to just toggle back and forth in place. Meaning you stay on the current line when pressing it. This appears to be the same behaviour as Katvan's. * Geany: * Pressing `End` ... takes you to the end of the line, so the last possible row of the current line. It stays there if you continue on pressing it. * Pressing `Home` ... same as Sublime. My suggestion: * `End` takes you to the very end of the line. Multiple presses then take you to the very end of the next line. * `Home` takes you to the very start of the line (so even before the indentation). Multiple presses then take you to the very start of the previous line. * Is the behaviour in this video intentional? Being able to move cursor through tab character as if it was made out of spaces. And no matter the type of indentation (spaces or tabs), it gets removed with a single press of the backspace key. I think spaces should just be spaces, and tabs just tabs, without *hidden* shortcuts, but of course you're the one to decide. https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ab395cfc-b819-448d-84eb-e3b2519362a5 * Finally, more of a request if it makes sense for this editor. Please allow commenting selection. Either with a shortcut, right-click, or the file menu bar. This would toggle `// ` of the selected lines.

comment.body:
> But it seems that End going first to the end of the row and then to the end of the line in word-wrapped lines is pretty universal among all classes of word processors and editors, so it might be more meaningful to improve this upstream than only in Katvan. I'll need to look into that.

I was mistaken here. Checking MS Word and Google Docs (at least), going only to the end the row and staying there (not going to the end of the paragraph) is the standard behavior for word processors, so it makes sense that that is what `QTextEdit` would implement out of the box. I'll need to customize that in Katvan specifically.

> Edit:
Quick update on the alt-tabbing situation. I'm almost convinced that the problem arises when Alt is (accidentally) pressed just before alt-tabbing. Because that Alt press goes to the menu bar, and when you come back, you can't simply press Alt again to return to the editing field.

That's the default behavior on Windows, no? That pressing `Alt` alone causes the menu bar to receive (and keep) focus. That does not happen in Linux (neither X11 nor Wayland). Not much I can do with that I think.

P.S if you have something substantial more to add, it is best to add a comment on the thread - it sends a notification so I can see your update without going to the issue.

>  Sometimes, the starting indentation is unbreakable (can't be deleted with backspace), e.g. the start of a list. I assume it's still the case in the newest version v0.10.0 even though I couldn't make it happen.

There was one case that was fixed in v0.11.0, but you probably didn't encounter it since it had to do with BiDi directionality markers. I am not aware of any others at the moment, so I'll need an example reproduction to investigate.

> Finally, more of a request if it makes sense for this editor. Please allow commenting selection. Either with a shortcut, right-click, or the file menu bar. This would toggle `//` of the selected lines.

Not now, sorry. Not in v0.12.0 either probably. Feel free to open a separate issue for that request to see if anyone else is interested.

pull_request.title: Following pandas 3.0, make `Day` cftime offset non-`Tick`-like
pull_request.body:
<!-- Feel free to remove check-list items aren't relevant to your change -->

In pandas 3.0, `Day` will no longer be considered a `Tick`-like frequency (pandas-dev/pandas#61985). This PR ports this change to the cftime version of this offset. The main implication in the cftime / xarray context is that it means the `offset` and `origin` options in `resample` will no longer have an effect when resampling to a daily frequency. As in pandas-dev/pandas#62101, warnings will be emitted if non-default values are passed.

- [x] Closes #10640
- [x] Tests added
- [x] User visible changes (including notable bug fixes) are documented in `whats-new.rst`

review.body:
I have some notes in-line, but overall...

I'd appreciate it if this could be split into multiple commits.

1.  Refactor the library functions
2. Get rid of the `do_concat_dtb_overlays` task, since we've established that it's completely unnecessary - L4TLauncher doesn't process overlays concatenated to the kernel DTB that it reads, either from the extlinux config, nor from the android kernel-dtb partition. Instead, just install the dtb if UBOOT_EXTLINUX_FDT is set.  (I know this wasn't in your PR, but I think it would be a good idea to add)
3. Add the overlay support in the extlinux config. This should be kept separate from `TEGRA_PLUGIN_MANAGER_OVERLAYS`, since the extlinux ones are applied *in addition* to the ones attached to the bootloader's DTB.
4. Maybe switch to setting `UBOOT_EXTLINUX_FDT` by default for the device tree, too, for consistency. Just seems odd to have overlays in the config with out the base device tree.

And can you verify that all this works with UEFI signing enabled - i.e., that signing happens for all the overlays, so they all get their `.dtbo.sig` files installed?

pull_request.title: l4t-extlinux-config: add support for OVERLAYS
pull_request.body:
This PR adds support for OVERLAYS in extlinux.conf to meta-tegra.  I haven't found this feature officially documented anywhere but it's referenced in forums like https://forums.developer.nvidia.com/t/place-custom-overlay-file-via-extlinux-conf/298287.  This feature is useful for anyone who wants to be able to modify devicetree overlays listed in `TEGRA_PLUGIN_MANAGER_OVERLAYS` without the necessity to do a capsule update, either by hand modifying in their `/boot` directory or using the `TEGRA_SWUPDATE_BOOTLOADER_INSTALL_ONLY_IF_DIFFERENT` feature of the [swupdate demo](https://github.com/OE4T/tegra-demo-distro/tree/master/layers/meta-tegrademo/dynamic-layers/meta-swupdate#tegra_swupdate_bootloader_install_only_if_different).

If/when this commit goes in I have a backport I'm planning for r35 branches which will also pull in a rebased commit from r36 branches of edk2-nvidia to support this on Jetpack 5 targets as well.  I've tested to ensure this works on kirkstone, see https://github.com/OE4T/meta-tegra/compare/kirkstone...Trellis-Logic:meta-tegra:kirkstone+overlays-extlinux-feature?expand=1 for preview. This means all device tree content should be able to be synchronized with rootfs content across the Jetpack 5/6 release series.

For those who don't specify `USE_OVERLAYS_IN_EXTLINUX = "1"` there should be no change with this PR, devicetree overlays will continue to come from spiflash only.

One thing I didn't take on with this task but could... I don't believe the logic in `do_concat_dtb_overlays` [here](https://github.com/OE4T/meta-tegra/blob/651e0898cb47ccc86c0ed5c7617fcfeadd7fda1f/recipes-bsp/uefi/l4t-launcher-extlinux.bb#L50-L55) actually is used by anything as far as I can tell. I could rename this function to reference its dual use for copying overlays or remove the concatenate part.

If/when this goes in I'll also reference it in the wiki page at https://github.com/OE4T/meta-tegra/wiki/Using-device-tree-overlays or I could work on a reorg/retitle of this page since it's about more than just devicetree overlays at this point.

# Commit Text
As discussed in [1], overlay source on JP5/6 targets appears to come only from the update capsule content in spi flash and not from either the content appended to the extlinux dtb.  This means if a slot switch occurs the devicetree overlay content used will match the last capsule update as opposed to the content overlayed on the dtb file referenced in extlinux.conf.  This also means slot switches don't apply dtb overlay changes when using slot switching instead of capsule update as a software update strategy for non bootloader components (see the TEGRA_SWUPDATE_BOOTLOADER_INSTALL_ONLY_IF_DIFFERENT feature at [2] for example).

With this patch, add support for writing the OVERLAYS value in the extlinux.conf file.  Specifiying

```
UBOOT_EXTLINUX_FDT = "/boot/${DTBFILE}"
USE_OVERLAYS_IN_EXTLINUX = "1"
```
in your local.conf or machine config will
* Copy all .dtbo files in TEGRA_PLUGIN_MANAGER_OVERLAYS list into the /boot directory of the rootfs when building the l4t-launcher-extlinux.
* Reference each .dtbo file in the extlinux.conf file, applying it as a part of the ExtLinuxBoot process in L4TLauncher.

1: https://matrix.to/#/!YBfWVpJwNVtkmqVCPS:gitter.im/$OJAkyoJCMQDfiamxJGULUseBv7vgH2fJy9cVLMbhh4g?via=gitter.im&via=matrix.org&via=3dvisionlabs.com
2: https://github.com/OE4T/tegra-demo-distro/tree/master/layers/meta-tegrademo/dynamic-layers/meta-swupdate#tegra_swupdate_bootloader_install_only_if_different

# Testing

Testing on master with jetson-orin-nano-devkit-nvme

1. Set in the local.conf:
```
UBOOT_EXTLINUX_FDT = "/boot/${DTBFILE}"
USE_OVERLAYS_IN_EXTLINUX = "1"
IMAGE_INSTALL:append = " dtc"
```

2. After boot, generate a DTS copy of the first overlay using logic like this:
```
cat /boot/extlinux/extlinux.conf | sed -n 's/.*OVERLAYS[[:space:]]\+\([^,]*\).*/\1/p' | xargs cat | dtc -I dtb -O dts >  /boot/first-overlay-original.dts && cp /boot/first-overlay-original.dts /boot/first-overlay-modified.dts
```
3. Modify the /boot/first-overlay-modified.dts by adding a line `test = "overlay-modified"`.  The resulting difference should look like this:
```
diff /boot/first-overlay-original.dts /boot/first-overlay-modified.dts
--- /boot/first-overlay-original.dts
+++ /boot/first-overlay-modified.dts
@@ -7,6 +7,7 @@
                target-path = "/";

                __overlay__ {
+                        test = "overlay-modified";

                        reserved-memory {
                                #address-cells = <0x02>;

```
4. Convert the modified dts file into the first overlay in the OVERLAYS list:
```
dtc -I dts -O dtb -o /boot/first-overlay-modified.dtbo  /boot/first-overlay-modified.dts 
cat /boot/extlinux/extlinux.conf | sed -n 's/.*OVERLAYS[[:space:]]\+\([^,]*\).*/\1/p' | xargs cp /boot/first-overlay-modified.dtbo
```
5. reboot
6. Verify the test marker is added to the device-tree from the overlay
```
root@jetson-orin-nano-devkit-nvme:~# cat /proc/device-tree/test
overlay-modified
```

issue.body:
Signed-off-by: Igor Bezukh <ibezukh@redhat.com>

Runbook PR: https://github.com/openshift/runbooks/pull/318

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
In an upgrade scenario it can happen that duplicate wasp-agent
deployment can appear, since previous wasp-agent deployments
were manual and in a different namespace.
Therefore in order to make sure the user is aware of it we
are adding an alert which will rely on the a metric of memory
overcommit percentage and presence of wasp namespace.


**Reviewer Checklist**

issue.title: Existing authorized SSH keys in the VM guest are overwritten
issue.body:
**What happened**:
Custom authorized SSH keys that were added to the file `~/.ssh/authorized_keys` are removed by kubevirt.

**What you expected to happen**:
The custom keys should not be removed.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
1. Create a secret with a public SSH key.
2. Create a VM with `AccessCredentials` that refer the secret and use the `qemuGuestAgent` propagation method.
3. Run the VM, log in and add a second key to `~/.ssh/authorized_keys`.
4. Change the key in the secret, and wait until it is propagated to the VM.

The `~/.ssh/authorized_keys` will not contain the second key that was not added by kubevirt.

issue.title: [BUG] App won't launch from .msi, and .exe throws unknown software exception
issue.body:
**Program version**
v6.0.0-rc.2

**Describe the bug**
When I install RPGMTranslate using the .msi installer, nothing happens when I try to launch the program. No error, no window, just nothing.

When I try installing via the .exe instead, I get the following error message:

`An unknown software exception (0x000001d) occurred in the application at location 7FF6CDE8A380. Click OK to terminate the program.`

This message originally appeared in Spanish:

`Se produjo una excepci√≥n unknown software exception (0x000001 d) en la aplicaci√≥n en la ubicaci√≥n 7FF6CDE8A380. Haga clic en Aceptar para finalizar este programa`

I‚Äôve installed both the .NET Runtime 9.0 and the Visual C++ Redistributable 2015‚Äì2022, as recommended, but the issue persists.

issue.title: Database performance optimizations for person quality scoring system
issue.body:
## Problem
The person quality scoring system is currently extremely slow due to complex aggregation queries across multiple tables with numerous LEFT JOINs.

## Proposed Database Optimizations

### 1. Materialized Views for Aggregated Metrics
Pre-compute person statistics that rarely change:
```sql
CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW person_film_stats AS
SELECT 
    mc.person_id,
    COUNT(DISTINCT mc.movie_id) as total_movies,
    COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN m.canonical_sources ? '1001_movies' THEN mc.movie_id END) as canonical_movies,
    AVG(em.value) FILTER (WHERE em.metric_type = 'rating_average' AND em.source = 'imdb') as avg_imdb_rating,
    AVG(em.value) FILTER (WHERE em.metric_type = 'rating_average' AND em.source = 'tmdb') as avg_tmdb_rating
FROM movie_credits mc
JOIN movies m ON mc.movie_id = m.id
LEFT JOIN external_metrics em ON m.id = em.movie_id
GROUP BY mc.person_id;

CREATE UNIQUE INDEX ON person_film_stats(person_id);
```

### 2. Specialized Composite Indexes
Optimize the most expensive JOIN operations:
```sql
CREATE INDEX external_metrics_movie_type_value_idx 
ON external_metrics(movie_id, metric_type, source, value);

CREATE INDEX movie_credits_person_movie_role_idx 
ON movie_credits(person_id, movie_id, credit_type, role);

CREATE INDEX festival_nominations_person_won_idx 
ON festival_nominations(person_id, won) WHERE won = true;
```

### 3. Denormalized Summary Tables
Pre-aggregate festival statistics:
```sql
CREATE TABLE person_festival_stats (
    person_id BIGINT PRIMARY KEY,
    total_nominations INT DEFAULT 0,
    total_wins INT DEFAULT 0,
    oscar_nominations INT DEFAULT 0,
    oscar_wins INT DEFAULT 0,
    cannes_nominations INT DEFAULT 0,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP
);
```

### 4. Partitioning for Large Tables
Partition external_metrics by source:
```sql
CREATE TABLE external_metrics_new (
    LIKE external_metrics INCLUDING ALL
) PARTITION BY LIST (source);

CREATE TABLE external_metrics_imdb PARTITION OF external_metrics_new 
FOR VALUES IN ('imdb');

CREATE TABLE external_metrics_tmdb PARTITION OF external_metrics_new 
FOR VALUES IN ('tmdb');
```

### 5. JSONB Indexes for Canonical Sources
```sql
CREATE INDEX movies_canonical_1001_idx 
ON movies((canonical_sources ? '1001_movies'));

CREATE INDEX movies_canonical_criterion_idx 
ON movies((canonical_sources ? 'criterion'));
```

### 6. Pre-computed Collaboration Scores
```sql
CREATE TABLE person_collaboration_stats (
    person_id BIGINT PRIMARY KEY,
    avg_collaborator_score FLOAT,
    top_collaborator_scores JSONB,
    collaboration_diversity FLOAT,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP
);
```

### 7. Query Optimization via CTEs
Use Common Table Expressions instead of multiple LEFT JOINs:
```sql
WITH person_movies AS (
    SELECT person_id, array_agg(DISTINCT movie_id) as movie_ids
    FROM movie_credits
    GROUP BY person_id
),
person_ratings AS (
    SELECT pm.person_id, AVG(em.value) as avg_rating
    FROM person_movies pm
    CROSS JOIN LATERAL unnest(pm.movie_ids) as movie_id
    JOIN external_metrics em ON em.movie_id = movie_id
    WHERE em.metric_type = 'rating_average'
    GROUP BY pm.person_id
)
SELECT * FROM person_ratings;
```

### 8. Background Job Optimization
- Use `pg_cron` to refresh materialized views periodically
- Implement incremental updates instead of full recalculations
- Cache scores with time-based expiration

### 9. Database Configuration Tuning
```sql
-- Increase work_mem for complex aggregations
ALTER SYSTEM SET work_mem = '256MB';

-- Optimize for read-heavy workloads
ALTER SYSTEM SET random_page_cost = 1.1;
ALTER SYSTEM SET effective_cache_size = '4GB';
```

### 10. Batch Processing Strategy
- Calculate scores in batches during off-peak hours
- Use COPY instead of INSERT for bulk operations
- Implement queue-based processing with priority levels

## Expected Impact
These optimizations should reduce query time from seconds to milliseconds by:
- Eliminating redundant calculations
- Pre-computing expensive aggregations
- Optimizing JOIN operations with targeted indexes
- Reducing I/O through strategic caching

The most impactful changes would be:
1. **Materialized views** - Could improve performance by 100-1000x for frequently accessed metrics
2. **Denormalized summary tables** - Eliminate expensive JOINs entirely
3. **Composite indexes** - Reduce query planning time significantly

## Implementation Priority
1. Start with materialized views (biggest impact, easiest to implement)
2. Add composite indexes (quick wins)
3. Implement denormalized tables with triggers/batch jobs
4. Consider partitioning for future scalability

Related to #325

issue.title: Create mechanism to label PRs with `do-not-merge/needs-sig` if SIG label is missing
issue.body:
Suggestion is that we label pull requests (and maybe issues also) with `do-not-merge/needs-sig` so that we can include them into the triage.

Steps required:
* create label in labels.yaml
* configure application of label in prow config, example for k8s: https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/blob/a0144ec94e0add4efb61cfc4ba8be1d95e16b6db/config/prow/plugins.yaml#L709

@vladikr @iholder101 FYI

> [@iholder101](https://github.com/iholder101) this is how they do it inside kubernetes: [kubernetes/test-infra@`a0144ec`/config/prow/plugins.yaml#L709](https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/blob/a0144ec94e0add4efb61cfc4ba8be1d95e16b6db/config/prow/plugins.yaml#L709)
> 
> I'd be happy to approve a PR if we get consensus on that matter
> 
> Looks awesome!
> I think that adding the `needs-sig` label is beneficial anyhow and shouldn't be blocked on the redundant sig labels (if any?).
> I'd be happy to see something like that! 

 _Originally posted by @iholder101 in [#14621](https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/issues/14621#issuecomment-2890812984)_

feat: Implement comprehensive modeling framework with GUI

This commit delivers a complete, feature-rich hydraulic and hydrological modeling framework, built in response to user requests for a Preissmann-based model and a rapid modeling tool.

The project was developed in three main stages:

1.  **1D Hydraulic Model (`preissmann_model`)**:
    - A stable and verified model that solves the Saint-Venant equations using the implicit Preissmann scheme.
    - Includes support for hydraulic structures like `Gate` and `Pump` as internal boundary conditions.

2.  **Coupled Modeling Framework (`common` package)**:
    - A `BaseModelComponent` interface and `SimulationController` allow for connecting different model types (e.g., hydrological and hydraulic) into a single simulation.
    - Supports network topologies, including converging and diverging branches via a `Junction` component. This framework can handle any directed acyclic graph of model components.

3.  **Rapid Modeling GUI & Interface**:
    - A GUI built with the `eel` library for visually building model networks by dragging and dropping components, editing their properties, and defining connections.
    - A YAML configuration file format for defining models and networks without code.
    - A `ConfigParser` that reads the YAML file and automatically builds the simulation.
    - A generic `run_from_config.py` script to execute models directly from the configuration file.
    - The GUI provides real-time feedback during simulations, including a live log and a live plot of results. It also allows for post-simulation analysis and plotting.

The project is fully documented with a GUI manual and a comprehensive case study to demonstrate its capabilities.

issue.body: ## Review Pull Requests üëã Hey there @24127031-Jishnu! Welcome to your Skills exercise! Let's learn to collaborate with others using pull requests. As you complete each step, I will respond in the comments to: - check your work and give feedback - share next steps - occasionally share tips - congratulate you when you finish! comment.body:
## Step 1: Open a pull request

_Welcome to "Review pull requests"! :wave:_

Let's get started by opening a **pull request** on some changes that were recently added to the `update-game` branch.

### What is a pull request?

A **pull request** is a collaboration area where work in one branch is reviewed before merging it into another branch. It has different tabs to manage the conversation and easily review changes.

- **Conversation** - A general log of the pull request activity. It also provides an open space for fellow collaborators and the community to provide ideas, suggestions, and general feedback.
- **Commits** - A list of only the commits unique to the proposed branch.
- **Checks** - The results of any automations applied to the pull request using [GitHub Actions](https://github.com/features/actions). That's for another exercise, though. üòé
- **Files Changed** - A [Diff](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/quickstart/github-glossary#diff) view that easily shows the proposed changes in a before/after view. It also has options to add comments and reviews in context.

> [!TIP]
> You can [create a draft pull request](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/creating-a-pull-request) for unfinished work. This can help avoid accidental merges or premature reviews.

### :keyboard: Activity: Create a pull request

1. Open this repository in a new browser tab so you can work on the steps while you read the instructions in this tab.

1. In the top navigation, select the **Pull requests** tab.

1. On the right, click the **New pull request** button.

1. Under the **Compare changes** area, select the following options and click the **Create pull request** button.

   - **base:** `main`
   - **compare:** `update-game`

1. Set the **title** and **description** to the following.

   ```md
   Update game over message
   ```

   ```md
   Update the game over message so people know how to play again!
   ```

1. Click **Create pull request**.

1. With the pull request created, Mona will check your progress and share the next steps.

pull_request.title: New fix for Reactive Monte Carlo
pull_request.body:
**Summary**

This new fix performs Reactive Monte Carlo Molecular Dynamics (RMCMD) simulations for the simultaneous treatment of the doping reaction and morphology evolution in doped organic semiconductors. More details are provided in the documentation file, and also in our manuscript which uses this fix ([Raghuraman V, Verma A, Jackson N. All-Atom Reactive Monte Carlo Molecular Dynamics for Molecular Doping in Organic Semiconductors. ChemRxiv. 2025; doi:10.26434/chemrxiv-2025-713hw-v2](https://chemrxiv.org/engage/chemrxiv/article-details/688244a6728bf9025e09ab03)), currently submitted to peer-review.
Part of MC package.

**Related Issue(s)**

This is a new feature and does not address an existing issue.

**Author(s)**

Vishnu Raghuraman, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
Institutional email: vishnura@illinois.edu
Long-lived email: vishnu.raman@gmail.com

**Licensing**

By submitting this pull request, I agree, that my contribution will be included in LAMMPS and redistributed under either the GNU General Public License version 2 (GPL v2) or the GNU Lesser General Public License version 2.1 (LGPL v2.1).

**Backward Compatibility**

No backward compatibility will be affected. 

**Implementation Notes**

The source code changes are entirely confined to the new fix files (fix_rmc_partial.h and fix_rmc_partial.cpp). No other changes to any core lammps classes have been made. It is added to the MC package. The implementation has been validated in our manuscript (referenced above), which also contains more details about the theory behind the method. The compilation was tested on our group cluster (dual socket Intel Xeon Gold CPU with 48 cores) with Intel oneAPI 2021 compilers, and on the Purdue Anvil system with GCC 11.2 compiler. 

**Post Submission Checklist**

<!--Please check the fields below as they are completed **after** the pull request has been submitted. Delete lines that don't apply-->

- [ ] The feature or features in this pull request is complete
- [ ] Licensing information is complete
- [ ] Corresponding author information is complete
- [ ] The source code follows the LAMMPS formatting guidelines
- [ ] Suitable new documentation files and/or updates to the existing docs are included
- [ ] The added/updated documentation is integrated and tested with the documentation build system
- [ ] The feature has been verified to work with the conventional build system
- [ ] The feature has been verified to work with the CMake based build system
- [ ] Suitable tests have been added to the unittest tree.
- [ ] A package specific README file has been included or updated
- [ ] One or more example input decks are included

**Further Information, Files, and Links**

The data and results of our above-mentioned manuscript is made available at Box
https://uofi.box.com/s/1sf6jvf3lo7ctgr4yaia3s55zpubn9e6

This contains input files, data files and output structures which may be helpful for people wanting to use the fix.
